Authors: Nasafi F., Pangemanan F., Sfenrianto, Wang G.
Title: Factors affecting society intention to use the equity crowdfunding platform
Source title: International Journal of Emerging Trends in Engineering Research
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Nasafi, F., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Pangemanan, F., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Sfenrianto, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS-Information Systems, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Crowdfunding simply is funding from crowd or many sources or parties, can be started from collecting fund from families and friends then expanded to society through internet. In Digital Business Era, Indonesian urban society have not utilized equity crowdfunding to its maximum. Therefore, this research expected to discover the Factors Affecting Jakarta’s Society Intention to Use the Equity Crowdfunding Platform in Indonesia. This research collected data of 100 Jakarta’s citizen randomly. Data Analysis using the combination of 2 research model from previous equity crowdfunding research. This research proved that the factors affecting Jakarta’s society intention to use the equity crowdfunding platform in Indonesia are The Success of Equity Crowdfunding Platform Campaign and The Mature of Project Stage. © 2020, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Digital Business; Equity Crowdfunding; Equity Crowdfunding Platform and Project Stage; Intention to use

Authors: Dessi A., Nasafi F., Gresshinta, Wang G.
Title: Designing courier service (Jastip) application by using spark-based big data technology
Source title: International Journal of Advanced Trends in Computer Science and Engineering
Affiliations: Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Dessi, A., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Nasafi, F., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Gresshinta, Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Wang, G., Information Systems Management Department, BINUS Graduate Program-Master of Information Systems Management, Bina Nusantara University, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Jastip is an informal service that offers assistance to people in need or want to buy something but cannot go to the desired place to buy themselves for various reasons. Those who offer help will give you a service value for each item offered for them to buy. This phenomenon is a new business model that has the potential to be developed. Based on this phenomenon, it is necessary to design an application that can accommodate the phenomenon of Jastip. This application will design as a mobile application using Spark based Big Data technology. StealDeal is an online service application through a mobile application that provides discount product recommendations on websites that exist in Japan. In this application object design service only issues a test object design using a large data processing method in the system architecture design. Focus point of this design is the architectural design. © 2019, World Academy of Research in Science and Engineering. All rights reserved.
Author Keywords: Big Data; Jastip; Mobile Application; Spark
